subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Marco Sturm kept Boston’s hopes alive when he scored with 2 minutes 37 seconds left and the Bruins overcame three deficits Saturday night to beat the Canadiens, 5-4, and force a seventh game in Montreal.
snippet: Marco Sturm kept Boston’s hopes alive when he scored with 2 minutes 37 seconds left and the Bruins overcame three deficits Saturday night to beat the Canadiens, 5-4, and force a seventh game in Montreal.
